article_title: Ohio Politics Now: Kasich, Strickland weigh in on Scalia successor process
article_text:

article_metadata.description: The 2016 election was already heated and then over the weekend U.S. Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia died, leaving an opening on the bench. Politics quickly eclipsed mourning of the conservative jurist with Republicans - including Ohio Gov. John Kasich who is running for president - calling on President Barack Obama to allow the next president to nominate Scalia’s successor.
